intro: Bauhinia ternatensis, commonly known as the flame tree or velvet tree, is a deciduous leguminous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, trifoliate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range from pink to red, often resembling flames. The plant produces flat, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its vibrant floral display. Bauhinia ternatensis also has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility.
